page.title: 05VISITOR'S CENTRE
page.content: The{Sherwood Forest Visitor's {Centre}is now an important tourist centre in{Nottinghamshire. }There is a special display on the legend of{Robin {Hood}relating it to the reality of medieval life in Edwinstowe. There is also a{film-theatre}where slide shows can be seen on the{ecology}of the forest. There are many{signposted walks} including a special{nature trail for {the Visually Handicapped.}There is a{ {bookshop,tourist information bureau {and restaurant}where Maid Marian's Pippin Pie may be eaten. Many tourists come to see the{ {Robin Hood}display and the{Major Oak.} The{Rangers}organise a wide range of activities eg.{guided walks.}It is even possible to explore the Forest at night with rangers to see the bats and the moths and other nocturnal life.
